title: Sequences with Inequalities
abstract:
We consider infinite sequences of positive numbers. The connection between
log-concavity and the Bessenrodt--Ono inequality had been in the focus of
several papers. This has applications in the white noise distribution theory
and combinatorics. We improve a recent result of Benfield and Roy and show that
for the sequence of partition numbers $\{p(n)\}$ Nicolas' log-concavity result
implies the result of Bessenrodt and Ono towards $p(n) \, p(m) > p(n+m)$.
